channel.title: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?
channel.description:
Hello, So i have this very old PC that i don't feel like throwing away, Instead i'd rather just keep it and use it. ( Please don't tell to throw it away and buy a new one, I will one day but it's not today ).
[b]My PC specs and infos are like this:[/b]
Windows 8.1 - 64 Bit Intel Pentium E2160 @ 1.80GHz 4GB RAM ( Can only use 3.5GB :( )
CPU-Z Info:
[spoiler][img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j360/naseem142/CPU-Zspecs_zps96b5ba6e.png[/img][/spoiler]
_____
[b]And here is the new CPU that i'm thinking of getting - I got a deal of [u]58 USD[/u] for it:[/b]
[url=http://ark.intel.com/products/80800/Intel-Celeron-Processor-G1840-2M-Cache-2_80-GHz]Intel® Celeron® Processor G1840 (2M Cache, 2.80 GHz)[/url]
[b]My current CPU's full info:[/b]
[url=http://ark.intel.com/products/29739/Intel-Pentium-Processor-E2160-1M-Cache-1_80-GHz-800-MHz-FSB?q=intel%20e2160]Intel® Pentium® Processor E2160 (1M Cache, 1.80 GHz, 800 MHz FSB)[/url]
_____
So the questions are, Will i be able to install it onto my computer? If yes, Is it much better than my previous one that it's worth replacing?
Help is very appreciated, Thanks in advance.
For people with super computers.. Bare with me pls.

post on the forums

ok

item.title: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:8, topic:547616”]Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E7400 For 80 USD
Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E6750 For 84 USD

It’s a toss up because the 6750 has better specs but the 7400 is newer and a smaller lithography. I’d probably lean towards the 6750 though since it was the top brand of the generation previous to the 7000’s.[/quote]

Ah, i see… Thank you for your help i really appreciate it.

If i need help if something went wrong can i PM you?

Read full topic
item.source: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?

item.title: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E7400 For 80 USD
Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E6750 For 84 USD

It’s a toss up because the 6750 has better specs but the 7400 is newer and a smaller lithography. I’d probably lean towards the 6750 though since it was the top brand of the generation previous to the 7000’s.

Read full topic
item.source: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?

item.title: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:4, topic:547616”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=666524.msg4456571#msg4456571 date=1415250896]

Celerons are horrible and those CPUs have different sockets, so no.

Damn, then what can i install on that PC?
[/quote]
Any CPU with a LGA775 socket.[/quote]

Thank you!

I have found a couple cpus at my local pc store, which would you reccommend according to price,quality,speed?
You are much experienced than me in this , I dont want to mess up.

Intel® Pentium® Processor E2200 For 50 & 80 USD ( Found two dif stores )
Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E7400 For 80 USD
Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E4500 For 68 USD
Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor E6750 For 84 USD

( All of them have LGA775 sockets as you said it should )

Read full topic
item.source: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?

item.title: Can i install this CPU on my old PC?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:5, topic:547616”][quote author=t4 link=topic=666524.msg4456536#msg4456536 date=1415234648]
Celerons are horrible and those CPUs have different sockets, so no.
[/quote]
The CPU in my laptop is a Intel Celeron Haswell dual core at 1.4GHz with integrated graphics. Works ok for small games. Sure it’s outta date but it holds it’s own[/quote]
Cerlerons were made by Intel as a poorly performing, cheap CPU.

Read full topic

@naseem142 wrote:

Hello,
So i have this very old PC that i don’t feel like throwing away, Instead i’d rather just keep it and use it.
( Please don’t tell to throw it away and buy a new one, I will one day but it’s not today ).

My PC specs and infos are like this:

Windows 8.1 - 64 Bit
Intel Pentium E2160 @ 1.80GHz
4GB RAM ( Can only use 3.5GB )

CPU-Z Info:

[spoiler][/spoiler]

And here is the new CPU that i’m thinking of getting - I got a deal of 58 USD for it:

Intel® Celeron® Processor G1840 (2M Cache, 2.80 GHz)

My current CPU’s full info:

Intel® Pentium® Processor E2160 (1M Cache, 1.80 GHz, 800 MHz FSB)

So the questions are, Will i be able to install it onto my computer? If yes, Is it much better than my previous one that it’s worth replacing?

Help is very appreciated, Thanks in advance.

For people with super computers… Bare with me pls.
